result.execSummary:
The defendant Theresa L. Hindsley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Theresa L. Hindsley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Theresa L. Hindsley was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Theresa L. Hindsley was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Counts 1 & 2:
18 months Probation
No contact w/Baraboo Walmart
Undergo any counseling/treatment/evaluation per agent.
$471.66  Restitution with 10% Surcharge To: Walmart - Joint/several
$453.00 & $443.00 C/C & Supervision Fees (PAID THRU PROBATION)

Counts 3-5:  Dismissed

Paperwork handed in court.
Bench warrant issued & cancelled
Plea/sentencing hearing at 06-26-2015 01:00 pm

Defendant Theresa L. Hindsley in court with attorney Melville Peter Middleton.  Sue Mueller and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton gives status and explanation for non appearances.  Defendant is prepared to enter a plea today.  Matter to be recalled.  Victim notification needs to be met prior to plea.  Matter will need to be reset.  State request $200 cash bond.  Attorney Middleton argues for signature bond.  Resides locally, ties to the community.  Defendant is scheduled to start a jail sentence next week.  Contact has been good.  Request bond continue.  Court continues/reinstates bond.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Melville Peter Middleton in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Middleton request another one week stay.  State request warrant.    Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.
